programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim Carver is in a quandary after turning down Marie's proposal of marriage - could the imminent return of his old flame June Ackland have anything to do with his decision? Luckily, dizzy PC Honey Harman is on hand with her astrology book to give the confused copper a spot of romantic advice. Meanwhile, Danny Glaze finds himself in a terrifying situation as he hunts for missing teenager Nathan - the brother of gun-toting local rogue Prince - and Des Taviner interviews a witness who seems more interested in speaking to the scouse PC's superior, Sgt Sheelagh Murphy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne's loyalties are divided when she and Kerry Young are called to a dispute at a refuge where immigration officials are trying to extract a woman and child facing deportation. Eva Sharpe returns to work, but Phil Hunter doubts whether she's still up to the job as they investigate an alleged assault at a slick law firm, and June Ackland spies a wedding ring in Jim Carver's desk drawer _ is this going to be her lucky day?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne shows everyone her nasty side as she continues her stand against the immigration officials, prompting Superintendent Okaro to doubt her suitability as an officer _ and leading to a confrontation between the aggrieved PC and her no-nonsense superior Gina Gold. Eva Sharpe continues her investigation into the law-firm assault _ even when the alleged victim drops the charges _ while on the personal front, June Ackland struggles to hide her loneliness as Jim and Marie celebrate their engagement _ until an equally lovelorn colleague steps into the breach

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's the morning after the night before for June Ackland and Tony Stamp, who are tiptoeing around each other following their liaison _ could this be the start of a new station romance? Debbie McAllister investigates an attempted sexual assault by a taxi driver, and soon finds a likely culprit. The problem is, the man in question is Sheelagh Murphy's husband _ meaning someone has to tell the sergeant that she might be married to a rapist

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Luke Ashton is put out when old enemy Dale Smith returns to Sun Hill complete with sergeant's stripes. Superintendent Adam Okaro has serious doubts about whether Patrick Murphy is really the man behind the taxi assaults. June Ackland is hurt when she doesn't receive an invitation to Jim and Marie's wedding, prompting lovesick Tony Stamp to make a chivalrous gesture

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Miss Matty confides in Mary about Mr Holbrook's death, prompting her to inform Major Gordon of Jessie's regret over not marrying him. Dr Harrison tells Rev Hutton of his intentions toward Sophy and asks permission to court her, blissfully unaware that the generosity he has shown to Mrs Rose has accidentally created an unlikely love triangle. Penultimate episode of the costume drama, starring Judi Dench and Simon Woods

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Meanwhile, Dr Harrison suffers as his career, reputation and relationship all seem ruined, while Miss Galindo and Mr Carter grow closer as they face up to the tragedy of Hanbury. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Following the destruction of their home by the McGraths, Tilly and her grandmother are forced to live a life of solitude. Period drama, starring Carli Norris

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a locked room mystery when supermodel 'Birdie' returns to Great Slaughter

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Feature-length Christmas special from 2001. A veteran actress is shot through the heart during the filming of a darkly surreal love story, but the bullet appears to have passed through a plate-glass window without breaking it. With Maddy out of the country, Jonathan is lumbered with a pushy theatrical agent who has a nose for mystery. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha, Steven Berkoff, Mary Tamm and Jay Benedict

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. DI Joseph Chandler and DS Ray Miles investigate the deaths of four people who were slaughtered at a tailor's fortified workshop, a gruesome and seemingly impossible crime that has left London's East End gripped with fear. Edward Buchan joins the detectives once again, hoping his historical expertise will help them solve the grisly case. Thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The case takes on an almost supernatural edge when a second mass murder occurs, with no obvious signs of a break-in, no escape route and no forensics left at the scene. Chandler, Miles and the team unearth more about the infamous Ratcliffe Highway murders of 1811, hoping to avoid making the same mistakes and solve the case before further lives are lost. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The promise of romance is put on hold when news of another murder interrupts Luther's date with Mary. Determined to predict the copycat fetishist's next move, he throws himself into a pile of cold case files and after his public disagreement with Ripley, he orders the sergeant to investigate the killing of Jared Cass on his own. Meanwhile, a care-home cancer patient receives a chilling gift from a visitor, and three girls look forward to a night in - unaware of the danger lurking in their home. Crime drama, starring Idris Elba, Warren Brown and Ned Dennehy

programme.title: Gracie!
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks stars as Gracie Fields in this drama about the singer and comedienne from Rochdale, who in the 1930s became the nation's darling and the highest-paid film actress in the world. Gracie's wartime struggle between love and duty and the repercussions of her relationship with Italian-born Hollywood director Monty Banks are explored. With Tom Hollander

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: A widowed vicar arrives in Halifax with the intention of claiming Ann Walker's hand in marriage - and Eliza Priestley resolves to help him succeed in his objective. Anne sets out to prevent the clergyman causing any trouble, but discovers further threats to her relationship in the shape of Ann's personal demons and interfering family. Work continues apace on the transformation of the Lister estate, and a grisly discovery in the pig sty gives Mary Sowden reason to believe that Thomas is lying about exactly how his father disappeared

programme.desc: Crabbe has cause to regret getting involved in an elderly cookery writer's family affairs, and a series of squabbles among the staff only add to his woes. Comedy drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

Jim plans to work a short shift ahead of his wedding day, only to get trapped in a cellar with Polly while chasing a runaway boy

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie is stunned when Dennis reveals his true colours. Martin returns home from prison, but has it changed him?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Can Martin and Vicky keep their daring plan a secret? Meanwhile, Dennis juggles Joanne and Kat

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: Unambitious PC Hamish Macbeth's rural beat is rocked by two bizarre mysteries - the theft of salt from the local shop and the disappearance of a well-known bully - suggesting sinister forces could be at work. First episode of the comedy drama set against the backdrop of a sleepy Highland village, starring Robert Carlyle, Ralph Riach and Valerie Gogan

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Tinker and Lovejoy set out to unravel the meaning behind a strange carving of a Japanese firefly cage, helped by Lady Jane Felsham. Drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam learns a respected member of the community is harbouring a devastating secret and Joanna grows concerned about Alice's state of mind, while Andrew gets a taste of fatherhood and finds it to his liking. Medical drama, starring Joseph Millson, Haydn Gwynne and Gary Mavers

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Zoe struggles with motherhood and the realisation that her relationship with Alec has changed

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince receives some fatherly advice, while Penny hears about her mother's surprising history

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cupid's arrow targets Truly when a woman from his past returns with amorous intentions, so everyone lends a hand in liberating him. Frank Thornton, Peter Sallis and Brian Murphy star in the last episode to feature Thora Hird as Edie Pegden

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry wins a competition - but when the prize proves more trouble than it is worth, it spells disaster for him and everyone who helps him try to get rid of it. Mike Grady stars

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Excessive flushing sounds convince an elderly woman that her neighbour has killed his wife and is disposing of her body parts via the toilet. Naturally, Davies is sent to investigate, and it isn't long before the detective has gained a broken nose and an obsessive stalker. Meanwhile, Mod lands a job in the mobile catering industry. Anna Wing (once of EastEnders) guest stars in the detective drama, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gerry is spooked by the discovery of UCOS's latest victim - a cop, whose body has lain untouched under a basement for 30 years. As accusations of police corruption and underhand dealings begin to surface, Gerry has to face up to some skeletons in his own closet and it's a race against time for the team to help before his murky past catches up with him. While babysitting his grandson, Gerry becomes convinced that only he holds the key to the investigation and goes Awol to uncover the truth. Starring Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Amanda Burton's last appearance as forensic pathologist Professor Sam Ryan. When the bodies of two men are exposed by a landslide in Ireland, the subsequent investigation suggests the pair died in the sectarian violence of the 1970s, prompting Sam to make a long overdue and painful journey home. Bryan Murray, William Gaminara and Tom Ward also star

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Ann's mental health goes into a shocking downward spiral, while her overprotective family gather around her. Anne contemplates travelling alone, but after a call for help, she rushes to Crow Nest and witnesses first hand her lover's devastating breakdown. Aunt Anne and Jeremy do not share Marian's liking for the irritating Mr Abbott, and Thomas' grim secret threatens his relationship with Suzannah Washington. Anne reopens negotiations over the mine, but Samuel suspects there is more to her course of action than she is letting on

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Skylar's mistake has fatal consequences, but she may not be entirely to blame for the tragedy. programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An ageing film star decides to sell some antiques, much to the delight of Tinker, who is a big fan - but her house is robbed just before the auction. Ian McShane stars

programme.desc: Skylar struggles to forgive herself as the hearing reaches a verdict. programme.desc: Alfie's upset to see Kat and Dennis together. Gus attempts to do the right thing

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gus is asked to name his accomplices. Phil learns some terrifying truths about the past from Jack Dalton

programme.title: Hamish Macbeth
programme.desc: A newcomer causes friction in Lochdubh - but when she starts receiving threats, Hamish is forced to take action. Robert Carlyle stars

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An overzealous taxman sets out to snare Lovejoy - not to mention an axe-wielding jailbird determined to retrieve an ornate Arab head-dress. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dawn's son slips into a coma, leaving surgeons in a state of confusion as to what could have brought about his rapid deterioration. It's not long before estranged father Keith turns up on the scene, adding to the air of tension as his wife's involvement with Andrew comes to light. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Sarah Parish

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: As Fleur's christening approaches, the couple struggle to find appropriate godparents

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince upsets the female members of the Warrender family by crashing Penny's car and causing her mother to faint in the street

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Chaos abounds at an annual parade held to celebrate a famous battle. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up and Nora Batty prepares to sit on a float playing the part of his wife. Norman Wisdom makes a cameo appearance

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part two of two. Danny takes Gerry on the run as they search for the proof they need to prove his innocence - despite Gerry remaining tight-lipped about his involvement with dodgy dealings in his old unit. The stakes are high as the Unsolved Crime and Open Case Squad goes after one of the biggest crime families in London, and it's those closest to Gerry who are dangerously put in the firing line. programme.title: Silent Witness

Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.title: Rush (2013)
programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A father and son involved in a police chase end up on the wrong side of the law after making bogus claims, and two riders have an unlikely crash on a deserted street in lockdown

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: A woman who had never used online banking prior to the pandemic, but decided to try. However, after just one attempt she was contacted by fraudsters who fleeced her out of 30,000

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of houses in the South Yorkshire towns of Maltby and Dunscroft, and the village of Havercroft in West Yorkshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Sandown Racecourse, Surrey, and looks at a collection of accessories dating from the late 1700s to the 1960s belonging to and donated by local people. With the expert help of Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester, the Reds and the Blues battle it out

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara tries to deal with Miles, while Daniel and Joe spend the day on environmental work. Suni tries to help a friend and his new wife wrestle with some uncovered secrets

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers presents from Wallyford recycling centre in East Lothian, where items with potential for restoration include an old steel gate, a tired tub chair and a pine tallboy

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple from Brighton have a budget of 400,000 to buy their first home together and want a complete change of scenery. They've set their sights on the beautiful countryside of Fife, where Briony May Williams is on hand to help them spend their property pounds. Briony also meets a farmer rearing a herd of buffalo, then samples some Scottish mozzarella cheese, produced from their milk

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill propose new designs to turn a steep, inhospitable slope in Redditch into a haven the whole family can enjoy on a budget of 65,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team travels to Greenwich to help retired professional Primrose, who has mobility issues, by reconfiguring her desk space and creating a storage solution for her guitar

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve and Vinny worry about Suki as she is discharged from the hospital. Kathy is fretting about organising Lola's wake, Rocky tries to take the stress off her but a blast from the past throws him off track. Elaine tries to play matchmaker with Gina and Anna but gets things terribly wrong in the process

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The sale of new petrol and diesel cars will be banned in less than seven years. We're all supposed to be going electric, but so far less than one in 30 vehicles on Britain's roads are battery powered. So why aren't more of us going green? Reporter Richard Bilton takes a trip to find out what the electric vehicle revolution feels like and whether the UK is ready.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Drama, starring Sharon Horgan and Michael Sheen as a couple driven apart over the decision whether to stop care for their daughter's deteriorating health. After a late night emergency involving a chest infection, medical staff decide that the treatment is too invasive and actively causing pain and long-term damage. Her parents resolve to fight for the right to keep her alive no matter the cost, but tension soon grows in the family

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Harry Hill hosts as comedian Jack Dee and journalist Zing Tsjeng join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs have been booked by MAC cosmetics to work on the latest Viva Glam campaign starring drag artists. Not only will they be judged by their clients, who are experts in doing their own make-up, but Drag Race All Stars winner Trixie Mattel joins as a guest judge to keep an eye on their technique. At Glow Up studios, the competitors get to showcase their own drag personas as they work on themselves rather than their usual models

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The investigators expose an organised scamming network and look into some false insurance scams with footage that proves the claimant is lying

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: How scammers targeted a working mum and tricked her into moving her money into a 'safe' account. Michelle and Mavis meet with Dr Roberta Babb to find out more about the psychology behind scams

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin, Dion and Martel meet the owners of two flats with quirky layouts in Stoke, a large house in Kent and a grade 2 listed terrace in Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Gary Pe and Nick Hall give advice to two teams scouring Ardingly in West Sussex for items to sell at auction, where one of Willy Wonka's golden tickets goes under the hammer

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear and Claudia go on a date and Zara is confronted by Professor Anwar over a photo. Luca helps a woman who is being harassed over her gender

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey where she finds a drinks trolley, a wind-up gramophone and a collection of lampshades for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple leave land-locked Leicestershire for a coastline county. The couple visit places in Somerset and Devon looking for their new home

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee and Flo head to Wokingham to help Sylvia and Matthew transform their overgrown messy garden into their dream romantic space on a budget of 5,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Twickenham to help Babs revamp her spare room for her new Ukrainian house guest. They add some home comforts, a splash of colour and new and improved storage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat with Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The police investigate Suki's accident and Kathy finds out what Rocky has been hiding from her. Freddie meets with a psychiatrist to discuss his ADHD assessment and Jean worries he is hiding how he really feels about it. Elaine is in trouble with her stepdaughter-to-be

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kim rallies the troops for a surprise Ofsted inspection and Joe's day goes from bad to worse while the whole school is watching. Danny helps with the school knife crime initiative and Kai comes to Nicky's aid when she finds herself caught up with the wrong people

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Andrew and Nicci find themselves at odds after an ethics committee agree all treatment for Marnie should stop. Samantha tells them they can legally challenge the decision if they wish, presenting Andrew with a difficult choice and leaving Nicci turning to a surprising place for help. Katie finds herself stuck in the middle

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue brings the boys back together for a reunion, deep diving into the drama and leading them through outrageously funny party games

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: The ghosts try to help Sam and Jay protect their home from the neighborhood kids who annually vandalise the house on Halloween

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Pete gets a visit from his living wife, only to discover she's hiding a secret from him, while Sasappis gets angry when Thorfinn binge-watches their favourite show without him

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic modern pentathlon gold medal winner Joe Choong, ex-England rugby League player Jon Wilkin, snowboarder Aimee Fuller and former world squash number one Nick Matthew join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she is in the garden. Monty Don makes some changes to pots in the Jewel Garden, and also plants out squash and harvests gooseberries. Adam Frost visits an Arts and Crafts garden in North Yorkshire, and finds much to inspire and surprise. And Rekha Mistry reveals her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is in the 8x6 greenhouse assessing progress so far and Scott Smith replaces the ornamental arch in the picket garden with a yew tree alternative. Lizzie Schofield continues her series in which she helps a couple turn the patch of turf outside their new build into a terrific outdoor space, and Brian Cunningham has the latest from his own garden in Old Scone

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits the village of Pennan on the north coast of Aberdeenshire, which was made famous as the primary location for the film Local Hero. Rosie Morton takes part in a whale rescue exercise on the Firth of Clyde, joining volunteers to see how marine mammals entangled in fishing equipment are freed. Nick Nairn joins Dougie cook locally sourced monkfish to make fish tacos with soft flour tortillas

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Gardeners' World presenter Alys Fowler demonstrates how to grow salad ingredients in the garden, including tomatoes, lettuce and cucumbers, but a blight hampers proceedings. She then prepares lime-leaf salad, dandelion fritters and nettle beer

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Tommy Banks and Angellica Bell preside as the four winning families from last week's heats return to the kitchen to compete for the remaining two places in the finals. The teams must recreate a Catalan fish stew, then are given a whole salmon and challenged to come up with a selection of dishes that will use as much of the fish as possible

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour in Castile - a region famous not only for its vast plains and castles but also as the home of 11th-century military leader El Cid - before heading to La Mancha, an area renowned for its rustic dishes and wine production, as well as being the land of Miguel de Cervantes' literary character Don Quixote

programme.title: Meet Me in St Louis (1944)
programme.desc: A job offer tempts a banker to consider uprooting his close-knit family and moving to New York. However, his wife and children struggle with the prospect of leaving their friends behind, and are horrified when they realise they might miss out on the 1904 St Louis World's Fair. Meanwhile, teenage daughter Esther faces the abrupt termination of her romance with the boy next door. Musical, starring Judy Garland, Tom Drake and Margaret O'Brien

programme.title: Guys and Dolls (1955)
programme.desc: A gambler accepts a bet that he cannot win the heart of a strait-laced Salvation Army member. Meanwhile, his friend has to find a secret location for an illegal dice game he is organising - while also contending with the police, a mobster and a girlfriend desperate to drag him to the altar. Musical, starring Frank Sinatra, Marlon Brando and Jean Simmons. Songs include Luck Be a Lady Tonight and Sit Down You're Rocking the Boat

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents a collection of the best finds from the show's travels round the country

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor visits Milan, the capital of Lombardy, where he goes for aperitivo with a social media star and tries some of the Missoni family's favourite dishes, sampling brasato, polenta and freshly foraged mushrooms

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Giles Coren head to the Qasr Al Sarab Desert Resort in the United Arab Emirates, surrounded as far as the eye can see by vast sand dunes. Here, the pair work alongside the dedicated hotel staff and find out what it takes to create an atmosphere of palatial comfort in one of the world's most extreme and inhospitable environments

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: A look at the fierce rivalry between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe, and how their sporting prowess brought with it an intense level of media scrutiny as well as celebrity and glamour to Centre Court. While McEnroe's bad-boy antics infuriates the tabloids and the Wimbledon hierarchy, it was the seemingly calm and collected Borg who struggled to cope

programme.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975)
programme.desc: A young strait-laced couple stranded by a storm take shelter in an eerie castle, where they are enticed into the weird world of a menagerie of debauched characters - presided over by a mad sex-crazed transvestite scientist - and undergo a startling transformation as they let go of their inhibitions. Cult musical, with Tim Curry, Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick and the show's creator Richard O'Brien

programme.title: Glastonbury 2014
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the festival at Worthy Farm in Somerset, including from the headline sets by Arcade Fire, Metallica and Kasabian. Other artists taking to the site's many stages included Blondie, Bombay Bicycle Club, Disclosure, Dolly Parton, Ed Sheeran, Elbow, Ellie Goulding, Haim, Lily Allen, Kaiser Chiefs, Kodaline, Lana Del Rey, and Robert Plant & the Sensational Shape Shifters

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from King's Lynn, Norfolk. Her panel comprises Minister in the department for Levelling-Up, Housing and Communities Lee Rowley MP, Shadow Secretary of State for Work and Pensions Jonathan Ashworth MP, broadcaster Ayesha Hazarika, who was an adviser to the Labour Party, and peer and former Supreme Court Justice Jonathan Sumption

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Runcorn, Cheshire, where they meet two Craigs. Each has different ideas about what they want from their bland back garden. One wants a stylish, contemporary space with clean lines and the other wishes to fill the garden with wildlife. Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a 5,000 budget

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman takes Colin Murray on a food adventure in her home town of Anstruther. As well as its famous fish and chips, they discover how artisan bread is being made for the community. Briony May Williams bags bargains hunting for yellow stickers in the supermarket, Suzie Lee reveals how Greek-style yoghurt is made in Co Down and Onkar Singh Purewal discovers Swansea's community garden produce

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: To launch a new spirit distilled on the cheese farm where he lives, Banjo Beale is asked to design a rustic gin-tasting bar using salvaged materials found on the farm. This design is deeply personal journey for Banjo, as he aims to give back to the people who welcomed him and his husband Ro into their community, but with a launch party looming, and an ambitious plan to complete, will it live up to expectations?

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz show, presented by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers reach Austria - the home of Mozart, the Sound of Music - on the fifth leg of their biking excursion across Europe. The trip starts in Vienna, where the pair unravel the mystery of the two competing Sachertorte recipes and taste the latest version - Sachertorte Reloaded

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles presents the programme in which three artists are challenged to create pieces for people they have never me, travelling to Shropshire to meet a buyer who wants to mark her recent return to her roots following a health scare

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The extraordinary animals and people who make their homes in mountain ranges around the world, beginning with the Rockies. The mountains are the spine of North America, a beautiful wilderness of snowcapped peaks and hidden valleys, home to many animals including cougars, wolves and grizzly bears

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein revisit cases previously featured, beginning with the conviction and execution of Edith Thompson in the 1920s

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Michael Baggott assess items at Barrow Hill Roundhouse in Derbyshire. Presenter Paul Martin visits nearby Renishaw Hall to learn about the Sitwell Trio - three siblings who took the artistic and literary world by storm in the early 20th century

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels across Dorset, beginning in Portland Harbour, home to some of the finest sailing waters in the UK and the location for the 2012 Olympic sailing events. In the county town of Dorchester, Michael hears the story of the Tolpuddle Martyrs, who paved the way for today's trade unions

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The team follows the search for artefacts from the Second World War, joining marine archaeologists in the Solent as they raise a Fairey Barracuda divebomber. Elsewhere, a dig in the Lake District tells the moving story of the Windermere Boys, and in Aldbourne in Wiltshire, archaeologists search for personal items from the most famous American unit of the US army, 'Easy Company', who were stationed there in 1943 and 1944

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: With plenty of fledglings, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are keeping up with the comings and goings at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Megan McCubbin revels in a botany bonanza at Durlston Country Park, a national nature reserve on the Isle of Purbeck, which in the spring is simply buzzing with life, while Gillian Burke heads to Anglesey

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at how the conflict became an intelligence war, as the police and the army made efforts to infiltrate paramilitary organisations and recruit informers. Anne Marie reveals how a loyalist gun attack at a funeral in Milltown Cemetery in West Belfast in 1988 prompted her to plant firebombs in city centre shops, primed to explode at night. She then became caught up in an intelligence web of informers and interrogation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig uncovers a stash of secrets, while Alan Davies, James Acaster, Daliso Chaponda and Cariad Lloyd lend a hand with the quite interesting facts

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury 2015
programme.desc: A round-up of highlights from the festival held at Worthy Farm in Somerset, including performances by headliners Florence + the Machine, Kanye West and the Who, as well as Mary J Blige, Motorhead, Caribou and Young Fathers

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Drama about the changing fortunes of a comprehensive school and the staff's ongoing personal and professional crises

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A reimagined look back at the 2022/23 season's gripping FA Cup journey through a homage to classic video games

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team travels to Greenwich to help retired professional Primrose, who has mobility issues, by reconfiguring her desk space and creating a storage solution for her guitar

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The curators continue their restoration of Paul McCartney's childhood home in Liverpool, trying to track down a key section of wallpaper for the living room, and opening up a room the public has not yet seen - the bedroom where the former Beatle's parents slept. Across town, a project is under way to catalogue and clean a vast collection of photographs discovered in a four-storey Georgian house that was once the home and studio of Edward Chambr Hardman, one of Britain's most significant photographers

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, including St Helens v Wigan Warriors and Wakefield Trinity v Leeds Rhinos

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz show, presented by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A beachcombing scrap metal artist, a nautical resin worker and a fairy-tale sculptor create seaside-themed pieces for buyers from Whitstable. Nick Knowles hosts

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: This episode looks at life on the highest mountain range on Earth, the Himalayas, home to many extraordinary animals and remarkable ancient cultures. The programme follows snow leopards as they creep into isolated mountain villages searching for food, and monkeys huddling for warmth in a hidden, frozen forest, and the athletes who compete in the gruelling Everest marathon

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein look back at their examination of the historic case against Charlotte Bryant, and the story of a murder that tore a family apart in the 1930s

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Some of the best unseen finds from the show's valuation days from around the country, including visits to the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke and Ragley Hall in Warwickshire

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo alights at Wareham to visit Dorset's internationally renowned Jurassic Coast. He heads through Swanage, Poole and Sandbanks, before ending his journey on Brownsea Island

programme.title: Digging for Britain: The Greatest Discoveries
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts re-examines the key archaeological sites of Anglo-Saxon Britain and finds the evidence of a warrior culture and the enormous wealth of their aristocracy

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Cornwall's Tintagel, famed as the legendary birthplace of King Arthur. Ben discovers Tintagel was potentially more important than London a thousand years ago, based on recent evidence unearthed at an archaeological dig overseen by English Heritage. It was found that over 2,000 people were living here which, at the time, which would have made it the largest settlement anywhere of its kind in Britain

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan dig a little deeper into the behaviours seen on the live nest cameras at RSPB Arne in Dorset, as well as covering the topical wildlife stories of this season. Megan McCubbin travels down to a quarry on the Isle of Purbeck to find out why this location is so important for bats, and Gillian Burke continues her exploration of Anglesey

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at all the stuff that's been going on in the news this week, with Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Jen Brister, Rhys James and Ahir Shah

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury 2016
programme.desc: Highlights from the festival, featuring performances by Adele, ZZ Top, Christine and the Queens, ELO, Laura Mvula, Tame Impala, the 1975, Ellie Goulding, Foals, PJ Harvey, Muse, Earth, Wind and Fire and Coldplay

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Finals week begins with the four hopefuls heading to Istanbul, where they are paired up to cook two local dishes rooted in centuries of tradition, mentored by one of Turkey's best-known chefs - Refika Birgl. They then work a busy lunch service with chef Fatih Tutak at Turk - the only restaurant in the city to have been awarded two Michelin stars - before cooking lunch for the British Consulate General and various other guests, including three judges from the Turkish version of MasterChef

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The aspiring chefs are put through their paces by celebrated chef Clare Smyth, who cut her teeth with pioneers Gordon Ramsay and Alain Ducasse, at her central London restaurant Core. They each cook one of her food creations at a special lunch for a select group of chefs including Sat Bains, Tom Kitchin, Jonny Lake and Nieves Barragn Mohacho. Can the amateurs hold their nerve or will the pressure prove too intense?

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: Framed through the world-famous Wimbledon tournament, this series revisits a golden age of tennis during the 1970s and '80s that changed the sport forever. The series begins in 1975 as two tennis greats - Billie Jean King and Arthur Ashe - aim to win Wimbledon titles but also, in their own ways, to change the world for the better. Back in the late '60s, as the women's liberation movement becomes headline news, King took up the gauntlet for women in sport, spearheading the drive for equal prize money and equal treatment of women

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Les Dawson hosts an EastEnders special of the comedy game show, with early stars of the soap Peter Dean, Leslie Grantham, Paul Medford, Sandy Ratcliff, Wendy Richard and Gillian Taylforth filling in the blanks in the hope of matching the contestants' answers. From November 1986

programme.title: Pop Quiz
programme.desc: Mike Read asks the questions in the 1980s quiz, with teams made up of Phil Collins, Robert Plant, Bill Bruford, Suzi Quatro, Colin Moulding and Geoff Deane. First broadcast in May 1982

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Opera singers from around the world gather at St David's Hall for the 40th anniversary of the prestigious international competition. In the opening round, singers from South Korea, Canada, England and South Africa perform with the Welsh National Opera Orchestra, hoping to win a place in Sunday's final. The judges are Brian McMaster, former director of the Edinburgh International Festival, Argentinian mezzo-soprano Bernarda Fink, Welsh soprano Rosemary Joshua, composer Errollyn Wallen and Aidan Lang, general director of Welsh National Opera. Presented by Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby

programme.title: Sacred Music: The Story of Allegri's Miserere
programme.desc: Simon Russell Beale explores the 300-year history of the sacred choral work, which was decreed by the Pope to be too beautiful to be heard outside the Sistine Chapel. An English organist, a choirmaster from Worcester and the great composers Mozart and Mendelssohn all played a part in the transformation of Allegri's original 17th-century composition into the haunting music known today. Featuring a performance of the piece by award-winning choir the Sixteen, conducted by Harry Christophers

programme.title: The Borg v McEnroe Tie-Break 1980
programme.desc: The story of the famous Wimbledon final between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe, which went to five sets including a mammoth tie-break in the fourth

programme.title: John McEnroe: Still Rockin' at 60
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents an intimate profile of the tennis champion. The programme features contributions from family and friends including his wife - new wave singer-songwriter Patty Smyth - long-time sporting rival Bjorn Borg, and Chrissie Hynde of the Pretenders, who provides an insight into McEnroe's musical passions. Sue pays a visit to McEnroe's art gallery and examines how he has continued playing until the age of 60 after his retirement from the professional circuit

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob examines the darker side of one of Britain's most original and inventive artists, as she delves deep into the history, cinema and art of America - as well as her own personal past. Parker is a sculptor working with found materials, creating beauty from acts of brutality, including an exploded shed, piles of squashed silver and the charred remnants of a burnt church. This year, she embarked on the most high-profile commission of her career, the roof of New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Looters made the most of an opportunity when the MSC Napoli ran aground in January 2007, spilling its cargo on Branscombe beach in Devon. However, they were reviving a tradition that stretches back centuries - connecting coastal communities around Britain to a sinister profession. Author Bella Bathurst embarks on an epic journey from the Isles of Scilly to the Orkney Islands to explore wrecking

programme.title: Brian Cox's Jute Journey
programme.desc: The Succession actor travels to Calcutta, retracing the journey of jute workers who started out in his home city of Dundee and went on to seek their fortunes in India. On the way he meets Lily Thompson, who went deaf while working in the mills, and spent years using a special sign-language to communicate with the other workers. He also meets members of the Calcutta and Moffusil Society and samples deep-fried jute

programme.title: Neutrino: Hunting the Ghost Particle
programme.desc: The astonishing tale of how scientists have battled against the odds to detect and decode the neutrino - the strangest, most elusive particle in the universe

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose sets off from Ladram Bay, heading for the chalk cliffs of Beer Head in South Devon. Here John Scott takes him underground on a tour of Beer Quarry caves, where until a few years ago limestone had been extracted for almost 2,000 years. Continuing along the coastal path to Charmouth, he learns about fossil hunting and ammonites and after enjoying the wild orchids in the ancient wildflower meadows of West Hay farm, begins the steep climb up to Golden Cap, the highest point on the path with stunning views along the Jurassic Coast

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: A tour of Britain's mining heritage takes Fred from Cornwall to Scotland, where he visits sites of lead, slate, tin and coal extraction. Along the way, the machine-mad former steeplejack has a chance to man a winding engine and descends a mine shaft while strapped to the top of the cage

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms: The Real Story
programme.desc: The true story behind the BBC One Sunday night drama. In 1947, the Assisted Passage Scheme began, devised by the Australian government to bring in white British settlers. For just 10, they could start a new life in a sun-drenched land of opportunity, and over the next 25 years, more than a million people took up the offer. The scheme's pioneers tell their story

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nicholas Crane goes to the Cornish coastline and discovers the mystery and tragedy behind past shipwrecks. He learns how boats were often lured onto the rocks by men with lanterns and then looted for their cargo

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: The crew of HMS Queen Elizabeth completes the vessel's sea trials, testing an innovative new firefighting system for the first time and marking the 100th anniversary of a plane being successfully landed on a moving ship. The carrier returns to Portsmouth, which will be its home port for the next 50 years, while the pilots of its fighter jets go to the US for additional training

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team investigates the science and engineering helping the UK to blast into space. Chris Lintott visits a rocket company near Glasgow to find out how rockets are built

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present the second round as singers from China, Turkey, Croatia and the home nation of Wales perform pieces by Bizet, Donizetti, Verdi and Rachmaninov, as they compete for a place in Sunday's final. Welsh tenor Jeffrey Lloyd Roberts makes a special appearance

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: The gravedigger and amateur cameraman profiles the area's countryside by filming its wildlife and people. He begins his exploration by trying to build a badger hide, from which he hopes to observe and record the animals' behaviour over the next 12 months

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: The red deer's rutting season begins, providing the wildlife film-maker with the opportunity to seek out a stag he accidentally upset the previous year after getting a little too close for comfort. He also enlists the help of a friend in dealing with a medical problem that could affect his work

programme.title: Men at the Barre: Inside the Royal Ballet
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker Richard Macer is invited to film with a golden generation of talented young male dancers at the Royal Ballet to find out what it takes to be an elite dancer. Throughout the film, Richard learns that in the past, the man's role was just to lift the ballerina into the air, but now, the top male dancers have fanbases that even rival the best ballerina's. He also explores changes in choreography, which is starting to reflect masculinity in different ways, mirroring the changing perception of what it is to be man outside in the wider world

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose sets off from Ladram Bay, heading for the chalk cliffs of Beer Head in South Devon. Here John Scott takes him underground on a tour of Beer Quarry caves, where until a few years ago limestone had been extracted for almost 2,000 years. Continuing along the coastal path to Charmouth, he learns about fossil hunting and ammonites and after enjoying the wild orchids in the ancient wildflower meadows of West Hay farm, begins the steep climb up to Golden Cap, the highest point on the path with stunning views along the Jurassic Coast

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age

Along the way, the machine-mad former steeplejack has a chance to man a winding engine and descends a mine shaft while strapped to the top of the cage

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms: The Real Story

For just 10, they could start a new life in a sun-drenched land of opportunity, and over the next 25 years, more than a million people took up the offer. The scheme's pioneers tell their story

programme.title: The Lakes with Paul Rose
programme.desc: The explorer digs out his rucksack and heads for Windermere in the Lake District. The National Park attracts 18 million visitors each year, and is now a World Heritage site. Here, Paul finds out why the early tourists thought the Lakes was one of the most dangerous spots in the country. He also plunges into the world of long-distance swimming and helps the staff who run the boats on the lake and meets a Holocaust survivor who was airlifted to Windermere in 1945 as part of a mercy mission involving 300 orphans after the Second World War

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: Fred visits the North East, a region rich in transport history, to explore the development of Britain's railways, from the first steam locomotives to the record-breaking Mallard. A visit to York's National Railway Museum offers the chance to ride a replica of Stephenson's Rocket, while at Ffestiniog Railway he learns about the computer-aided design process used for new locomotives

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to donate blood but is aghast to find out how much he has to give. When he discovers he has a rare blood type, he wants to find out where it will end up

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry seek sanctuary from the news so they can watch TV highlights of an England v Bulgaria football match without knowing the result, but they are pursued by the relentless Flint, who has bet them they cannot escape the final score. James Bolam and Rodney Bewes star, with Brian Glover and Donald Gee

programme.title: The Witness Is a Whale
programme.desc: Soviet whaling reports reveal that whales once roamed the oceans in vastly greater numbers than has ever been estimated. This documentary considers how this changes things - if the number of whales was larger, then their role in the ocean was more important than anyone imagined - and how it affects the attempts to save these extraordinary mammals

programme.title: Britain's Wild Places
programme.desc: An insight into the lives of a family of water voles living on the Cromford canal in Derbyshire. The mammals spend their lives in a frenzy of activity, swimming, feeding and breeding, but are on the verge of becoming an endangered species due to poisoning, hunting and the increasing lack of natural living habitats

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present the third round, with the assistance of British soprano Nadine Benjamin, as singers from South Korea, Sweden, China and South Africa perform pieces by Handel, Wagner, Puccini and Mozart in their bid to win a place in Sunday's final

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The story of the influential African musician Fela Kuti, who is remembered not only as the creator of the Afrobeat genre but also as an outspoken political revolutionary who criticised military regimes in his native Nigeria. A counter-cultural revolutionary, he fought injustice with his music and provoked society with his lifestyle, on one occasion marrying 27 wives in a single ceremony. When he died in 1997 from HIV, a disease that carried huge stigma in Africa, there was fear his legacy would die with him, but this film shows that the impact of his life and music is still felt today

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Theo, River, Arthur, Reece, Luna and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Giovanna has got a blue bib and blue sunglasses inside her bag. All the parents and babies have different blue toys and objects in their bags too, which are explored through play, songs and a story. Parents, carers, and their little ones at home are encouraged to hide a safe, baby-appropriate blue object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase, and then play with the items together! The traditional nursery rhyme Little Boy Blue features, as does a story about Baby Bear and Baby Tiger dressing up in blue things, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring the colour blue too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory scarves and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. Love Monster realises that she is right and starts beatboxing. The Fluffytowners start having fun again and begin cheering for him.

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is in Dinas Powys, just outside Cardiff, to walk the five-mile Salmon Leaps circular trail. The route takes him through ancient woodland and across the historical Cwrt yr Ala estate before he returns to Dinas Powys where the Village Show is in full swing. Wildlife expert Lizzie Daly goes in search of night creatures and Onkar Singh Purewal joins a dawn swim at Penarth

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: The celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1975 to present some of that year's TV gold. Clips feature a communal loo in Newtown, a man on a bed of nails and a horse whisperer, Carmarthen's coracle fishermen, Welsh cakes and a harp-making community. Plus, well-known south Wales band Sassafras and a comedy flashback from The Goodies

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Rush (2013)
programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The sale of new petrol and diesel cars will be banned in less than seven years. We're all supposed to be going electric, but so far less than one in 30 vehicles on Britain's roads are battery powered. So why aren't more of us going green? Reporter Richard Bilton takes a trip to find out what the electric vehicle revolution feels like and whether the UK is ready.

programme.title: Best Interests
programme.desc: Drama, starring Sharon Horgan and Michael Sheen as a couple driven apart over the decision whether to stop care for their daughter's deteriorating health. After a late night emergency involving a chest infection, medical staff decide that the treatment is too invasive and actively causing pain and long-term damage. Her parents resolve to fight for the right to keep her alive no matter the cost, but tension soon grows in the family

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: An emergency call comes in to the stroke unit at Bronglais Hospital, Aberystwyth. Issie is growing in confidence in helping stroke patients when they arrive, but is quickly reminded she has a lot to learn and experience to gain. A patient is blue-lighted in to A&E after being knocked off his bike, while Caitlin deals with a patient who has been admitted after having seizures

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple returning from living in Sweden for 25 years who want to find a home in Wiltshire, and goes for a ride with a professional carriage driver

programme.title: Paddington 2 (2017)
programme.desc: The lovable little bear has settled into his new life with the Brown family in London, becoming a much-loved member of the local community - until his search for a birthday present for his aunt leads to him being framed as a thief. While the Browns try to clear Paddington's name, he tries to make himself at home in prison, winning over the other convicts and getting involved in an escape attempt. Comedy adventure, starring Hugh Bonneville, Hugh Grant and Sally Hawkins, with Ben Whishaw providing the voice of Paddington

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin visits the Argyll Coast and Islands, which was designated Hope Spot status in 2019 because it is home to the only nursery in the world for the endangered flapper skate. He joins marine biologist Chris Rickard as he conducts research into these mysterious creatures of the deep. Adam Henson looks at the robots and artificial intelligence being developed that promise to revolutionise UK agriculture. And John Craven launches this year's photo competition in aid of Children in Need

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture displays of emotion from sea creatures, including dolphins getting an adrenaline rush from jumping, leaping and playing tricks in the waves. Spy cameras also capture displays of affection among manatees and cuttlefish courtship, as well as the mimic octopus passing itself off as other creatures to avoid predators

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second show this year from the Eden Project in Cornwall, where items include fragments of hair from the poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, a set of beads given as a gift from a Zulu king to the Royal Navy surgeon who treated him and a Greek plate dating back to 300BC. Also, Marc Smith hears the stirring story of the Second World War pilot who shot down five enemy aircraft in a single night

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Terry is forced to confide in Arty and Ron over a business venture, while Annie ignores her marital problems by accepting an invitation from Nick. Back at the hostel, Stevie convinces Pattie to spend the day with him and Kate leaves her hut behind in pursuit of a suburban address. With everyone preoccupied, Peter gets forgotten

programme.title: Rush (2013)
programme.desc: The 1976 Formula One Championship season is dominated by a fierce rivalry between two contrasting racers, as daredevil British driver James Hunt and methodical Austrian defending champion Niki Lauda put their lives on the line to outdo each other on the track. Fact-based drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Bruhl and Olivia Wilde

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The sale of new petrol and diesel cars will be banned in less than seven years. Reporter Richard Bilton takes a trip to find out what the electric vehicle revolution feels like and whether the UK is ready.

programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.title: Man of Steel (2013)
programme.desc: With the imminent destruction of their home planet approaching, a man and his wife seek to preserve their race by sending their infant son to Earth. The child's spacecraft lands at the farm of Jonathan and Martha Kent, who name him Clark and raise him as their own son. Though his extraordinary abilities have led to the adult Clark living on the fringe of society, he is forced to take a stand to protect his adopted home from a fanatical general from his own world, who intends to wipe out the human race. Sci-fi adventure based on the Superman comic-books, starring Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon and Russell Crowe
